title: Drawing, "Design for a Painted Harpsichord Cover", 1725–50
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and black wash on cream paper
provenance: From the Collection of Léon Decloux. In his collection in 1906; unattributed by him.
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: The figure of Fame, at the center, blows a trumpet and holds aloft a crown, a putto flies away at the left.  A bird in flight, arabesque vine tendrils and two mascarons complete the composition.  Framing line broken by garlands.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for a Painted Harpsichord Cover", 1725–50.
1725–50. Pen and black ink, brush and black wash on cream paper. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1911-28-96.
